title.narrative: 1.4.2 REDUCE DISPARITY IN RURAL & URBAN

description.narrative: Disparity between 20 convergence districts including selected urban slums and national average for NER and transition from PPE to grade one is reduced by 50 percent., which contributes to Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2016, women, children and youth in 20 selected districts, demand and benefit from increased and more equitable utilization of quality health, nutrition, population, education, water, sanitation and HIV services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Disparity between 20 convergence districts including selected urban slums and national average for NER and transition from PPE tograde one is reduced by 50 percent.

description.narrative: Comprehensive ECD Policy with approved operation and implementation guidelines, developed with UNICEF&39;s upstream technical support, and firm commitment from Government, contributed increased transition rates from pre-primary education to Grade 1 from 51 per cent to 96 per cent and mainstreaming of PPE | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of 3-5 years children attending early learning and pre-primary education in selected urban slums and UNDAF districts

baseline.value: 150,000 with 50% girls (2012), 4% attending withUNICEF's direct contribution

target.value: 2016:1.0 million with 50% girls, 30% with UNICEF's direct contribution
